channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Relations amongst the distances between $C^{*}$-subalgebras and some canonically associated operator algebras
item.description: arXiv:2501.13039v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that the Christensen distance (resp., the Kadison-Kastler distance) between two $C^*$-subalgebras $\mathcal{A}$ and $\mathcal{B}$ of a $C^*$-algebra $\mathcal{C}$ is equal to that between their enveloping von Neumann algebras $\mathcal{A}^{**}$ and $\mathcal{B}^{**}$ (resp., the tensor product algebras $\mathcal{A} \otimes^{\min} \mathcal{D}$ and $\mathcal{B} \otimes^{\min} \mathcal{D}$, for any unital commutative $C^*$-algebra $\mathcal{D}$).
item.dc:creator: Ved Prakash Gupta, Sumit Kumar

item.title: Every 2-quasitrace is a trace
item.description: arXiv:2501.13088v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A heretofore longstanding open question of Kaplansky was, "Is every Type II_1 AW*-factor a von Neumann algebra?" In this paper, we answer this question in the affirmative. As a consequence, we establish that every 2-quasitrace on a unital C*-algebra is a trace.
item.dc:creator: Alec Gow
